instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R? This is a power rail between the battery and a current sense resistor before the battery power feeds current to the rest of the machine. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
hello i have <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> after change faulty battery suddenly cant on.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 1.1v
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R</SIGNAL> 1.1v
what should i do next.
Thanks in advance

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Does it turn on with charger alone?
Post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage in this case.
If still no good, check diode mode to ground.

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 78450, member: 682"]
Does it turn on..
[/QUOTE]
still cant on with charger alone.
no chime, no fan spin.
got green light on charger then few seconds becomes orange.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> diode:0.155 1.1v stable

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Be sure F7140 is good.
Post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> basic voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 78455, member: 682"]
Be sure F7140 
[/QUOTE]
this solved by changing <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> 
found short at pin 3. thanks [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER]
